definition:
An outcome $s^*$ *strongly Pareto dominates* $s^\prime$ if:
$$\forall i\leq n \left[u_i(s^*)>u_i(s^\prime)\right]$$

An outcome $s^*$ *weakly Pareto dominates* $s^\prime$ if:
$$\forall i\leq n \left[u_i(s^*)\geq u_i(s^\prime)\right]$$

$s^*$ is *strongly Pareto optimal* if whenever $s^\prime$ weakly Pareto
dominates $s^*$, $\forall i\leq n\left[u_i(s^*)=u_i(s^\prime)\right]$.
That is, there is no strategy which provides at least as large a payoff
to each player and a larger one to at least one. $s^*$ is *weakly Pareto
optimal* if there is no $s^\prime$ such that $s^\prime$ strongly Pareto
dominates $s^*$.
